column4: Hello everyone. I am a Scala programmer using Ubuntu 9.04. The library I am using for my current project involves a lot of unicode symbols (mostly from Greek and Cyrillic alphabets). Is there any good way to type these unicode characters with minimum number of keystrokes?

Hello everyone. I am a Scala programmer using Ubuntu 9.04. The library I am using for my current project involves a lot of unicode symbols (mostly from Greek and Cyrillic alphabets). Is there any good way to type these unicode characters with minimum number of keystrokes?
I am not fond of command line editors. I use Eclipse for all my work. Thanks for the suggestion though.
